did.unittitle: Selected International Harvester Company documents and agreements from other Kheel Center collections on Microfilm,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Material from a variety of collections listed. Set made for an individual researcher and these sets provided to the Center as part of the arrangement.

bioghist.p: The International Harvester Company (IHC, later IH) is now called Navistar International Corporation, was an United States agricultural machinery, construction equipment, vehicle, commercial truck, and household and commercial products manufacturer. J.P. Morgan merged McCormick Harvesting Machine Company and Deering Harvester Company in 1902, along with three smaller companies, to form International Harvester. International Harvester sold off its agricultural division in 1985 and renamed itself Navistar International Corporation in 1986. [Wikipedia]

scopecontent.p: Duplicate negative copies available upon request, housed in 6399 mf, box 7.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Selected International Harvester Company documents and agreements from other Kheel Center collections on Microfilm #6053 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
